pullRequest.body:
---
<!-- The text above the `---` will become the commit message when your
PR is merged. Please leave a blank newline before the `---`, otherwise
GitHub will format the text above it as a title.

To indicate co-authors, include lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Co-authored-by: Author Name <author@email.com>

Any other comments you want to keep out of the PR commit should go
below the `---`, and placed outside this HTML comment, or else they
will be invisible to reviewers.

If this PR depends on other PRs, please list them below this comment,
using the following format:
- [ ] depends on: #abc [optional extra text]
- [ ] depends on: #xyz [optional extra text]
-->

[![Open in Gitpod](https://gitpod.io/button/open-in-gitpod.svg)](https://gitpod.io/from-referrer/)

nodes.body: The code looks very good to me and gives already a quite comprehensive approach! My only concern is about using "Presentation" because the data involves only the generators. I would suggest using `Generators` instead of `Presentation`.
Good point. Will change it.
Thanks! Could you also rename the file as `Generators.lean`? (as the file is already quite long, the additional stuff for presentation could be in a different file.)

### PR summary

#### Import changes

No significant changes to the import graph

---

<details><summary>

#### Declarations diff

</summary>

`+ Algebra.Generators`
`+ Cotangent`
`+ Cotangent.ext`
`+ Cotangent.map`
`+ Cotangent.map_mk`
`+ Cotangent.mk`
`+ Cotangent.mk_surjective`
`+ Cotangent.module`
`+ Cotangent.module'`
`+ Cotangent.of`
`+ Cotangent.smul_eq_zero_of_mem`
`+ Cotangent.val`
`+ Cotangent.val_mk`
`+ Cotangent.val_smul`
`+ Cotangent.val_smul'`
`+ Cotangent.val_smul''`
`+ Cotangent.val_smul'''`
`+ Hom`
`+ Hom.algebraMap_toAlgHom`
`+ Hom.comp`
`+ Hom.comp_id`
`+ Hom.equivAlgHom`
`+ Hom.id`
`+ Hom.id_comp`
`+ Hom.toAlgHom`
`+ Hom.toAlgHom_C`
`+ Hom.toAlgHom_X`
`+ Simps.σ`
`+ aeval_val_σ`
`+ algebraMap_apply`
`+ algebraMap_eq`
`+ algebraMap_surjective`
`+ comp`
`+ defaultHom`
`+ extendScalars`
`+ instance : AddCommGroup P.Cotangent`
`+ instance : Algebra P.Ring S`
`+ instance : Inhabited (Hom P P')`
`+ instance {R₀} [CommRing R₀] [Algebra R₀ R] [Algebra R₀ S] [IsScalarTower R₀ R S] :`
`+ instance {R₁ R₂} [CommRing R₁] [CommRing R₂] [Algebra R₁ S] [Algebra R₂ S] [Algebra R₁ R₂]`
`+ mapCotangent`
`+ mapCotangent_toCotangent`
`+ ofAlgHom`
`+ ofComp`
`+ ofSet`
`+ ofSurjective`
`+ of_add`
`+ of_val`
`+ of_zero`
`+ self`
`+ toComp`
`+ toExtendScalars`
`+ val_add`
`+ val_of`
`+ val_zero`
`+ σ`
`+ σ_injective`
`+ σ_smul`
<details>
  <summary>You can run this locally as follows</summary>


```bash
## summary with just the declaration names:
./scripts/no_lost_declarations.sh short <optional_commit>

## more verbose report:
./scripts/no_lost_declarations.sh <optional_commit>
```
</details>

</details>

Thanks!

bors merge

Pull request successfully merged into master.

Build succeeded:
  * [Build](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/9448313190/job/26022044798)
  * [Lint style](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/9448313190/job/26022044175)

**[lint-style]** reported by [reviewdog](https://github.com/reviewdog/reviewdog) :dog:
```suggestion (r • x).val = P.σ (algebraMap R₀ S r) • x.val := rfl ```
Could not this be replaced by the assumption that the map `R[I] → S` is surjective? Then, `σ` could be chosen afterwards.
I thought about it as well, but I'd prefer good definitional equalities when considering the canonical presentation `R[S] → S`.
I like the idea of `Algebra.Presentation` computably carrying all the data to describe `S` as an `R`-algebra.
Maybe rename the type of variables from `I` to `ι` (or something else), because it clashes with the name of the kernel?
Okay I (finally) renamed it to `vars`.

I am wondering about the naming scheme here: I would expect a finite presentation to be a `Presentation` in your sense where `I` is finite and the kernel of `R[I] → S` is finitely generated. So maybe only call a `Presentation` something where `I` is already finite? Then `Algebra.Presentation.Finite` could be the one with f.g. kernel.
I need this API for not-necessarily finite algebras so I cannot require I to be finite.
Should `σ'` be required to be an algebra homomorphism?
No, I don't think this is possible?
You are right, I confused myself. Sorry for the noise!

```suggestion
- `Algebra.Presentation.Cotangent`: The cotangent space of a presentation `P = R[X] → S`, i.e. the
```

In principle, `pp_dot` is no longer necessary:
```suggestion
@[pp_dot]
```
Same below.

pullRequest.title: [Merged by Bors] - feat(RingTheory/Presentation): Develop API for presentations of algebras.
